head.supplied: 3 October 1868 ¶ ¶ [Dr Mueller has been writing to me this morning with a complaint that as the cool nights are approaching their numbers [prostitutes] are increasing for the amusement of the soldier...

div.p: Bundle 1, unit 7, VPRS 1199 inward correspondence, VA 724 Victoria Police, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Transcribed 20.10.93. To proof.
name in full. Letter not found. Look for MS at Victoria Barracks.
On 3 October 1866, position, initials Trevor wrote to the Chief Commissioner of Police, F. Standish: 'Sometime ago I mentioned to you that the Botanical Reserve was infested with a gang of prostitutes: the British soldier being the attraction: you kindly sent a Policeman whom I saw walking them off.' He then alluded to the above letter and asked: 'Would you kindly allow a Policeman to take a look round some evening.' Standish sent Trevor's letter on 3 October to Mr Lyttleton's with the instruction: 'Let a Const: be told off'. A7952. Edward [...] Ry[all] replied on the same day: 'I have told off a Constable for this duty'. L3648, (Bundle 1, unit 7, VPRS 1199, PROV).
Trevor was in charge of the 40th Regiment, maybe we try the St Kilda branches?
3 October 1868
[Dr Mueller has been writing to me this morning with a complaint that as the cool nights are approaching their numbers [prostitutes] are increasing for the amusement of the soldiers.]
